text.tspan: 'C Tests' replaced with code to read a MemHex32 file, DMA it into DDR A,
and then use OCL to talk to a controller in AWS_BSV_Top that allows the
SoC to access memory (and therefore allow the CPU to run code there).
Fig 3: Replace AXI4L.32.32 to AXI4.64.64 by our SoC
Replace Step 2's 'AXI4L.32.32 to AXI4.64.64' block with SoC.
SoC may be WindSoC ("standalone SoC") or GFE SoC.
Test: Load MemHex32 for an ISA test, run it to completion.
Replace the AWS simulation test infrastructure
(SH tasks, DPI tasks, DDR models) with BSV infrastructure
(BSV top, BSV memory models) and be able to do the same thing
(load a MemHex32 file via "DMA", and allow the SoC to run it.
